msgSnippet: The class in JUnit *are* plain Java classes , so your real question is, Why use a framework? Simple answer: don t use it. Build your tests however you like.
messageBody:
The class in JUnit *are* "plain Java classes", so your real question is,
"Why use a framework?"

Simple answer: don't use it. Build your tests however you like. Try to test
ever-larger software. *Refactor your test code mercilessly.* (This step is
key.) You will eventually have JUnit or something very close to it.

More important question: is there a reason you prefer not to use JUnit? If
it hurts you to use JUnit, then don't use it.

JBR.
